Event.name: Arranging
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> puts a complex <fen>Theme</fen> into a particular <fen>Configuration</fen>, which can be a proper order, a correct or suitable sequence, or a spatial position.
<ex><fex name="Agent">He</fex> <t>arranged</t> <fex name="Theme">the elements</fex> <fex name="Configuration">in the pattern that we now call the periodic table</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Try to <t>order</t> <fex name="Theme">them</fex> <fex name="Configuration">by importance</fex>. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex> </ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to be in a particular <fen>Configuration</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>An entity that consists of parts which can be put into a configuration relative to each other and/or relative to their environment.</def-root>

Arg.name: Configuration
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state that holds of the <fen>Theme</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Theme</fen> as a result of the arranging action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the arranging action which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). With agentive use, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action ( eagerly, carefully). </def-root >

Arg.name: Location
Arg.definition: <def-root>The place in which the <fen>Theme</fen> is put into a <fen>Configuration</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> identifies the situation in which an <fen>Agent</fen> arranges a <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> is trying to bring about by changing the <fen>Configuration</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex><t>Arrange</t> the stones in a circle <fex name="pur">to acheive maximal effect</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Agent</fen> to change the <fen>Theme</fen>'s <fen>Configuration</fen>.
<ex><t>Arrange</t> the floats into a line <fex name="ins">with your oar</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to arrange the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>You must <t>array</t> them in a circle <fex name="mea">by concentration alone</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the Arranging act has occured. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: arrange.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put in a neat, attractive, or required order.

lexUnit.name: arrangement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action, process, or result of arranging.

lexUnit.name: array.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: display or arrange in a neat or impressive way.

lexUnit.name: deploy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bring or move into position for military action.

lexUnit.name: deployment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the arrangement (of troops or materiel) to make ready (for military action).

lexUnit.name: format.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arrange or put into a format.

lexUnit.name: justify.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: align text to both the left and right margins
